de.esoco.ewt.component

Interface TextControl.IsTextControlWidget

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Focusable, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasDoubleClickHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasEnabled, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasKeyDownHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasKeyPressHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasText, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TextArea.IsTextArea
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GwtCodeMirror, ValueBoxWrapper
    Enclosing class:
    TextControl

    public static interface TextControl.IsTextControlWidget
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasText, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Focusable, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasEnabled, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasKeyPressHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasKeyDownHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.dom.client.HasDoubleClickHandlers
    The interface that needs to be provided by all text control widgets implementations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Returns the position of the input caret.

    • Method Detail

      • getCursorPos

        int getCursorPos()
        Returns the position of the input caret.
        Returns:
        The caret position

      • getSelectedText

        java.lang.String getSelectedText()
        Returns the currently selected text. The returned string will be empty if no selection exists.
        Returns:
        The selected text

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns the editable state of this component.
        Returns:
        TRUE if the component is readonly

      • setCursorPos

        void setCursorPos(int nPosition)
        Sets the position of the input caret.
        Parameters:
        nPosition - The new caret position

      • setReadOnly

        void setReadOnly(boolean bReadOnly)
        Sets the editable state of this component.
        Parameters:
        bReadOnly - TRUE if the object shall be readonly

      • setSelectionRange

        void setSelectionRange(int nStart,
                       int nLength)
        Sets the selection of the text. A length of zero will remove the selection.
        Parameters:
        nStart - The start index of the selection
        nLength - The length of the selection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given selection doesn't fit the current text

      • setVisibleLength

        void setVisibleLength(int nColumns)
        Sets the number of text columns to be displayed by this instance.
        Parameters:
        nColumns - The column count
